Índice Índice Couting

My body has two sides

Place your hands on the table. Do they appear similar? Can you identify any differences between them?

Left handRight hand
Figura 1: Hands reprsentation. The source codes are available in project GitHub (History Tracers, , Source code)

Now, bring your hands together with palms facing and examine your fingers. Do they possess identical sizes? What about your hands—are they also of the same size?

Drawing

Fold a piece of paper in half. Place your left hand on one side and trace its outline with a pencil. Once completed, repeat the process with your right hand on the other side.
Left handRight hand

My body

Next, take a look at your arms. Do they exhibit similar features? How about your legs? Can you observe they are equl, where one side of your body mirrors the other? Compare with your friend or teacher to see if they also have equal sides.

Conclusion and practice

Our bodies are unique, with symmetrical sides. And we're not alone—many other organisms exhibit similar symmetry. Explore leaves of plants and observe other animals to confirm their symmetrical features.
